abstract: Class-action lawsuit filed against University of North Carolina by former student athletes Rashanda McCants, who played women's basketball, and Devon Ramsay, who played football, accuses school of academic fraud and failing to educate athletes; filing comes shortly after release of Kenneth L Wainstein's report, which found that many North Carolina athletes took classes that appeared to be shams.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit was filed in state court just months after a report found that from 1993 to 2011, some 3,100 students took classes at North Carolina that sometimes did not take place or require any work.
snippet: A lawsuit was filed in state court just months after a report found that from 1993 to 2011, some 3,100 students took classes at North Carolina that sometimes did not take place or require any work.

headline.main: Claiming Academic Fraud, Ex-Athletes Sue North Carolina and N.C.A.A.
headline.print_headline: Claiming Academic Fraud, Ex-Athletes Sue North Carolina and N.C.A.A.
